1.text: Stand fast therefore in the liberty with which Christ has made us free, and be not entangled again with the yoke of bondage.

2.text: Behold, I Paul say to you, that if you be circumcised, Christ shall profit you nothing.

3.text: For I testify again to every man that is circumcised, that he is a debtor to do the whole law.

4.text: Christ is become of no effect to you, whoever of you are justified by the law; you are fallen from grace.

5.text: For we through the Spirit wait for the hope of righteousness by faith.

6.text: For in Jesus Christ neither circumcision avails any thing, nor uncircumcision; but faith which works by love.

7.text: You did run well; who did hinder you that you should not obey the truth?

8.text: This persuasion comes not of him that calls you.

9.text: A little leaven leavens the whole lump.

10.text: I have confidence in you through the Lord, that you will be none otherwise minded: but he that troubles you shall bear his judgment, whoever he be.

11.text: And I, brothers, if I yet preach circumcision, why do I yet suffer persecution? then is the offense of the cross ceased.

12.text: I would they were even cut off which trouble you.

13.text: For, brothers, you have been called to liberty; only use not liberty for an occasion to the flesh, but by love serve one another.

14.text: For all the law is fulfilled in one word, even in this; You shall love your neighbor as yourself.

15.text: But if you bite and devour one another, take heed that you be not consumed one of another.

16.text: This I say then, Walk in the Spirit, and you shall not fulfill the lust of the flesh.

17.text: For the flesh lusts against the Spirit, and the Spirit against the flesh: and these are contrary the one to the other: so that you cannot do the things that you would.

18.text: But if you be led of the Spirit, you are not under the law.

19.text: Now the works of the flesh are manifest, which are these; Adultery, fornication, uncleanness, lasciviousness,

20.text: Idolatry, witchcraft, hatred, variance, jealousies, wrath, strife, seditions, heresies,

21.text: Contentions, murders, drunkenness, revelings, and such like: of the which I tell you before, as I have also told you in time past, that they which do such things shall not inherit the kingdom of God.

22.text: But the fruit of the Spirit is love, joy, peace, long-suffering, gentleness, goodness, faith,

23.text: Meekness, temperance: against such there is no law.

24.text: And they that are Christâ€™s have crucified the flesh with the affections and lusts.

25.text: If we live in the Spirit, let us also walk in the Spirit.

26.text: Let us not be desirous of vain glory, provoking one another, envying one another.
